title: FRQ Score
stimulusHtml:
General Considerations

The response must correctly articulate a defensible claim or thesis that responds to the prompt and establishes a line of reasoning.

For Task A, the thesis must make a defensible claim that establishes a line of reasoning about whether or not mass political protests can successfully persuade authoritarian governments to produce effective change in a countryusing one or more of the provided course concepts: civil society; political participation; or legitimacy.

For Task B, the response supports the claim with one piece of specific and relevant evidence from one or more course countries. The evidence is relevant to one or more of the provided course concepts.

For Task C, the response uses reasoning to explain why the evidence supports the claim or thesis, using one or more of the provided course concepts.
descriptions: The responses accomplish none of the tasks set by the question.
The response accomplishes one of the tasks set by the question.
The response accomplishes two of the tasks set by the question. For a student to earn a point for C the student must first earn the B point.
The response accomplishes three of the tasks set by the question. For a student to earn a point for C the student must first earn the B point.
The response accomplishes four of the tasks set by the question. For a student to earn a point for C the student must first earn the B point.
